alert.note: Alert for Coryell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 28 at 2:56PM CDT until April 28 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL CORYELL COUNTY... At 256 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles west of Fort Gates, or 7 miles southwest of Gatesville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Fort Gates around 305 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include King, Mound, Flat, Leon Junction, Arnett, Pidcoke and The Grove. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter now! Get to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building and avoid windows.
